intro: Andesanthus paleaceus, commonly known as the Andean beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
